Reviews.Title: Frustrated with Lenovo support
Reviews.Author: Get Lost
Reviews.Content: I've been a Lenovo T-series user for about a decade, going through 4 T-series laptops for work.  I finally bought a personal laptop for myself, because the soon-to-be released T440 is trying to be something it's not, which is an ultrabook (no more ultrabay, touch screen, internal battery).  So I thought the T430 would be the last of it's kind for traditionalists who like Windows 7 better than 8, and like that this laptop can be upgraded with a 2nd hard drive, etc.However, my complaint is that I received a model with a noisy fan.  Search for "T430 noisy fan" on a web search engine and you'll find several others who had the same issue as me.  The noise is an extremely annoying high pitched whine, like a jet turbine.  So after having it for a day, I had to send it into Lenovo support.  Per their instructions, I removed the hard drive and replaced the hard drive cover.They shipped it back a few days later and seemed to have fixed the fan issue (if you get a noisy fan model, demand that they replace the fan with a quiet fan.  There's nothing that can be done with software to fix it).  However, when I tried putting the hard drive cover back on, the screw wouldn't thread back into the laptop.  I called Lenovo again, simply asking them to send me a 5 cent replacement screw.  They refused, saying the "Hard drive cover is cosmetic", even though it's the piece that prevents my hard drive from falling out of my computer.  Hey, the hood on my car is cosmetic, but if a car shop gives it back to me with a broken latch, I expect them to fix it.I ended up taking a screw from an old Lenovo which was the proper width, but too long, so I had to use a hack saw to get it to the correct length.  Even though they have a 30 day return policy (through Lenovo) I decided to keep the laptop for now because I didn't want to go through the hassle of buying another laptop, but I'm unhappy with the frustration I've went through after buying a brand new machine.On the plus side, the lighted keyboard is nice and I don't mind the new chick-let style keys, though I wished they kept the page up / down and Home / End keys in the same place they were located on the T410 / T420.

Reviews.Title: Noisy fan! thumbs down
Reviews.Author: Kedar
Reviews.Content: Performance wise this laptop is good except it has one major flaw - its fan is always on and is too noisy.This is a known issue and Lenovo recommends a BIOS update to fix it. But it does not work.[...]I would not recommend this product. I returned it within 2 days!

Reviews.Title: Worse than a Black Friday Special
Reviews.Author: Vivekananda Nemana
Reviews.Content: Let's face it: PCs tend to run cheap. And that's fine. I've been living off of $500-below laptops ever since I had my first one in college, and while they've had their issues, the issues were minor and hardly enough to push me into getting a more expensive PC or switching over to a Mac.I had been using an HP, which ran smoothly but was having some battery trouble, and instead of replacing the battery like I should have I decided to reward myself instead with a $700 Lenovo T430. It's a well-respected make, and the T-series are known for being reliable and "great business laptops," etc.What a mistake. As soon as it came out of the box, the T430 was already slower than my two-year old HP that I bought at a Black Friday special (to give you an idea of how cheap it is). I use my computer as much as the next millennial, and usually I like to just close the lid and let it sleep instead of shutting the computer down altogether. Well, it takes two full minutes after I reopen the lid to get it back to form, especially w.r.t. Google Chrome, which lags horribly. I have to sit though an excruciating series of "Chrome is Not Responding" messages until I can get back to writing that email I was working on, or whatever.I feel stupid for having bought this now. 4 GB RAM are just not enough, and now I'll have to add RAM and probably also replace the hard drive with an SSD. I read online that the computer gets a lot faster once you do that, but the whole point is that you shouldn't HAVE to do that, after you've paid $750ish for a supposedly good/fast/reliable computer.There are other problems. For instance, the two-finger scrolling feature sometimes decides not to work. Just like that. Thirty seconds later, it works fine again. It's maddening. All I ask for is a fully functional touchpad and a Google Chrome that doesn't bonk, plus like a Word Processor. My needs are simple. This is why I use a PC. And it's why sh**ty Black Friday-deal laptops have worked fine. Apparently the $300 extra you pay for the Lenovo can't even buy you that.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: Skibane
Reviews.Content: 1. Very little pre-installed bloatware. You get all of the essentials, with virtually nothing to uninstall.2. Still available with the excellent Windows 7 OS - Doesn't force you to accept an inferior OS!3. Runs cool and silent - Even in a very quiet environment, the fan and hard disk are almost inaudible.4. Amazingly fast recovery from "sleep" mode - You can log in and start using the machine just a few seconds after wake up.This is my third ThinkPad - and the best, by far.No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: great laptop for the price.
Reviews.Author: jtfox76
Reviews.Content: ProWin 7x64500gb hard driveMobile i5 which runs at night clock speed than ultrabook i5Comes with win 8 license.Solid battery life (mine has 3cell)Light weightConsAs other reviews said the fan can be heard running but it is not terrible.

Reviews.Title: Great machine.
Reviews.Author: Bertha C. McKechnie "Armchair Gardener"
Reviews.Content: I'm an independent nurse practitioner, and bought this machine to keep my progress notes and medical documents.  I love everything about it except it's weight.  I have just ordered a second charging adapter to keep one at home and one at work to help with the weight.The keyboard is very comfortable and easy to use.  This machine has great features and will give me many years of service both at home and at work.

Reviews.Title: Freezes up ALL the time
Reviews.Author: T. Weidner
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this laptop in November 2013 for my birthday, it is now February 2014 and I have had continual problems with the laptop freezing up.  When it freezes, the computer won't respond to the Ctrl+Alt+Del to safely shut it down.  I've since done my own research and it appears Lenovo has been having serious issues with these laptops and is knowingly cranking out junk.  Quality has been sold out for short term profits.  I'm tired of buying pricey junk.

Reviews.Title: Poor value for price
Reviews.Author: Chaz
Reviews.Content: Performance:-I use this laptop for work and it is not the best productivity machine. 4 gbs of ram is fine if your intended use is casual, however having multiple spreadsheets open while running Adobe reader, IE and various other applications can easily leave you spending a frustrating amount of time waiting for process to run.-The battery life also leaves a lot to be desired, I've returned from 1-2 hour meetings shocked to discover how diminished the battery has becomeHardware:-This has been a killer for me. While I'm the only one at my company that has had this issue, I've already run through 2 hard drives. I work in treasury so having to reinstall software, online banking certificates and various other access is extremely frustrating. As far as I know, it's an issue with the laptop outside of the hard drive.-The last thing I find curious and a detraction is the design of the usb 3.0 ports. The ports themselves are recessed, about half and inch from the edge of the laptop itself. This is ok for cables, however it prevents usb drives from fitting.

Reviews.Title: Best laptop I have bought.
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome computer. I bought it a little over a year ago and I have not had any problems. This is also the computer that my company (a very large tech company) uses. If you are a specs over visual users, than I highly suggest this laptop. It doesn't look 'sexy' like a Macbook, but it runs amazingly. Also, the default model comes with 4 GB of RAM, and you can buy additional RAM, like another 4GB stick, on Amazon for something like $30.Advice, make sure you get the HD+ upgrade. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: power issue
Reviews.Author: Chen Hu
Reviews.Content: the power interface of this computer is not working just within a month and I don't think should have happened on a thinkpad.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: soniebird
Reviews.Content: Has everything I need and I am finding it very useful. Still getting used to the sensitivity....very sensitive! I could not ask for anything better!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product, but it was stolen before I could test it.
Reviews.Author: pafluxa
Reviews.Content: Haven't tested the product because it got stolen when it arrived to my country.However, I have personally tested many of these (that is why I wanted one!), and I can say you will not be disappointed at all. It is a great piece of hardware, tough as hell, spill resistant, I could be writing wonders of this guy forever.If you are not very worried about appearance and want some computer to watch movies after thermonuclear war, then this is what you have been looking for.For the hardware, the price is high, but always remember you are probably buying one of the most durable notebooks on the market. Just saying.

Reviews.Title: It is just as what I have used before.
Reviews.Author: Huiying Zhao
Reviews.Content: I used one Lenovo computer before. The new one gives same feeling and it is okay. But it is not light as I have imagined.

Reviews.Title: good shopping experience
Reviews.Author: dummyCat
Reviews.Content: the computer is at a real bargain, the quality is good and user experience is fantastic, wonderful shopping online this time

Reviews.Title: amazing product
Reviews.Author: li shaohua
Reviews.Content: finally i got my laptop this morning.before i paied for the laptop,i thought it was a heavy one.but to my surprise,i turned out to be a light one ,i loved the feeling when i armed with it .i checked the hard disc and it was used for 24 times,that's what i can accept.overall,this is thinkpad is a good one.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with the product
Reviews.Author: Sharon Miao
Reviews.Content: This is the second ThinkPad we bought. Consistent quality. CPU, RAM and harddrive all meets our requirements. We are happy with it.

Reviews.Title: feedback of lenovo
Reviews.Author: Adlet
Reviews.Content: I'm using this computer for work purposes and inet serfing.The keyboard is  really good.It better to buy with microoft office, because I waste my time for looking for good version of MO.

Reviews.Title: Poor Craftsmanship and bad ergonomics
Reviews.Author: Eric Scott Taylor, IV
Reviews.Content: The USB ports were bent and had to be unbent for use. The DVD drive, every single time I move the PC forward on my lap the stupid drive door opens up, (I have an older Lenovo and the open button is much more toward the back of the PC). No HDMI connector. Heavy!!!  If the DVD drive door wouldn't open so frequently I would have given it a 4 star rating. I also hate keys that are 3/4 size and 1/2 size...this is a company machine and I would not purchase for home use.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop and delivered early
Reviews.Author: rockyrue
Reviews.Content: I was a Dell guy until the IT person at work recommended Lenovo. Very pleased with the performance, style, weight and durability - a rugged but appealing case. It only comes in black and I liked not having to make a choice!!!I'm a ThinkPad convert!

Reviews.Title: very good.
Reviews.Author: Zhendao Han
Reviews.Content: it use well,i like its keyboard.and it's to my expectation.i will recommand it to my friends.that is all.if you give me some gifts,that will be cool.

Reviews.Title: Something is wrong with the right hand side of the bottom panel.
Reviews.Author: kyller1027
Reviews.Content: I am in china,Because in US IBM is much cheaper than in CHina, so i bough this computer and asked a friend brought it to China.  But this notebook has a problem, Something is wrong with the right hand side of the bottom panel. it tilt. someone said AMAZON is not very plitely to foreigh ID. And last year i bought two LEVIS jeans also have some problem.

Reviews.Title: Thanks, I Like it, that is what i was looking for,and i received with no issues. i recommend this for all Lenovo Buyers.
Reviews.Author: Mehmud Sattar
Reviews.Content: Thanks, I Like it, that is what i was looking for,and i received with no issues. i recommend this for all Lenovo Buyers.

Reviews.Title: It's a good product.
Reviews.Author: framesync
Reviews.Content: Beause it meet my expectations,the performance is good so that it is suitable for my job;It's is a little heavy;I'll recommend this to my colleague.

Reviews.Title: Impossible to select/hit enter
Reviews.Author: Koonstheman
Reviews.Content: I'm actually quite surprised this thing gets such high reviews. The only thing that I find above-average is the very good battery life. But to me, it has a huge fundamental flaw: the buttons one uses to make selections (I don't know what they are called) are atrocious. They are too small and require super-human strength to actuate any cell selection, Unless I got a lemon

Reviews.Title: Quality laptop
Reviews.Author: AMLM
Reviews.Content: LOVE this computer. Not sure why they shifted the control key but it's been fine once I got used to it.

Reviews.Title: I wish it come with window 7 disk
Reviews.Author: sandy hui
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer because it is window 7 but it did not come with a window 7 disk and I'm having a hard time to make one.

Reviews.Title: deficiency
Reviews.Author: LI PRLH HUIBIAO
Reviews.Content: Why didn't the fingerprint encryption？Lack of parts。Like assembling goods。This is a supplier? I could not accept it！

Reviews.Title: I will never buy another ThinkPad
Reviews.Author: Amazon buyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son, thinking that the ThinkPad was going to be a sturdy, fast and reliable computer for a middle school child.  Last week, my son used 3 fingers to pull the laptop toward him and the whole screen cracked.  I was watching him as it happened.  He did not grab the computer harshly.  In fact, he did not even touch the screen, he pulled from the cheap plastic frame around the screen.  This plastic frame which has never been securely fastened to the screen either.  We now have to send this back to the warranty service which will take weeks to resolve, if at all.  In the meantime, we had to get another laptop for school.  Lenovo sucks.  Do NOT buy this unless you want to waste your money.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: lich
Reviews.Content: the new thinkpad t seems more like  E series in keyboard,but I prefer the previous versions actually.If u have a win 8 system that you will not use a thinkpad battery management.
